result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Jerome Nelson Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David Jerome Nelson Jr not in court.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy appeared by video for David Jerome Nelson Jr.  Attorney Annie Louk appeared in court on behalf of Jon R Josephsen Jr. for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Jury Status Hearing. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO  JUDGE. Court further takes no action as to bail and vacates 10/17/2022 jury trial date.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Discharge Report - 8-17-22
Justice Point Pretrial Services Status Report received and filed.  bm
Court orders previous conditions to remain in full force and effect.

Defendant David Jerome Nelson in court with attorney Nicholas John Conrardy.  Defendant David Jerome Nelson in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Jury Trial. State requests an adjournment due to officer unavailability. Court grants request. Defense further requests to be heard on bail. Arguments heard. Court modifies cash bond to a signature bond, with other conditions. Case adjourned for Jury Status Hearing and Jury Trial dates, Br 16. Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case will be heard in room 503 of the courthouse.  Jury trial scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Received and Filed. NOTICE OF MOTION TO ADJOURN

Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy in court, defendant David Jerome Nelson not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties appeared by video means. State places offer on record and sets deadline to file plea forms for 7/1/2022. If no plea forms are filed by deadline State revokes offer. Trial dates remain as scheduled in Branch 16.

Defendant's Motion to Dismiss.  (David J. Nelson, Jr. - #374827, Dodge Correctional Institution, PO Box 700, Waupun WI 53963-0700).

Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy in court, defendant David Jerome Nelson not in court, in custody.  Any Spanczak for John Regowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy court clerk:  vk   Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.   Case adjourned for final pretrial and for jury trial in Branch 16.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
The Court takes no action on the motions filed by defendant on 3/16/22 and 3/17/22 because the defendant is represented by counsel.  mn

Defendant David Jerome Nelson in court with attorney Nicholas John Conrardy.  Defendant David Jerome Nelson in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Preliminary hearing proceeded. Motion to dismiss argued and denied by the court.  Sworn for the State: City of MKE Police Officer Alexander Verreault. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Stark.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Grayson, Br. 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Request For Substitution, Filed
received and filed.

Defendant David Jerome Nelson in court with attorney Thomas Reed.  Defendant David Jerome Nelson in custody.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a State v. Lee hearing. Attorney Reed provides an update to the Court. Attorney Nicholas Conrardy is in court and will accept this case from the PD's Office. Case remains calendared as previously set in Branch PE. Defendant David Jerome Nelson not in court, defendant in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court.  Hearing scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant David Jerome Nelson not in court, defendant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant David Jerome Nelson not in court, defendant in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was not present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant David Jerome Nelson in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Defendant David Jerome Nelson in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  David Jerome Nelson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 4.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
